Reviews.Title: “Good location to Union Station”
Reviews.Author: muffin55
Reviews.Content: Stayed here only one night before going on train. A bit dingy and front desk staff quite rude. Would not recommend to anyone else.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, clean and comfortable”
Reviews.Author: C T
Reviews.Content: While taking a train trip in mid-March, I spent one night at the Metro Plaza Hotel. I was confident in staying here based on previous recommendations and I am here to say that my experience was great. The location is perfect in many ways. It is within walking distance of the Los Angeles Union Station. It is across the street from the locally famous Philippe restaurant and one block from the bus lines. Around the corner is Olvera Street, a short, one-block street that is home to authentic Mexican history and street vendors. The hotel lobby was clean and the staff was professional and friendly. They voluntarily upgraded my room to a large suite with a separate kitchen area with microwave and refrigerator. The room was clean, the bed was comfortable, and the linens were nice. It is an older hotel so expect furnishings to be comparable. They offer a continental breakfast, which I cannot comment on, only because I wished to dine at Philippe. Overall, I got a great value and would stay here again. I searched other hotels in the immediate vicinity; none were close to my travel budget nor had the great location. You will not be disappointed if you choose to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay in a good location”
Reviews.Author: RubyWanderlust
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for one night after an overnight trip to LA. Check in and check in were fast, and the desk staff were friendly. The room was a good size, with an excellent bathroom. The hotel hallways were unusually cold and the temperature control unit in our room didn't work, so I wasn't able to make the room as warm as I would like (it was a chilly day in LA). The location is great, very close to Union Station, and there are plenty of places to eat very close to the hotel. I didn't feel unsafe at all in this area of town, but I am used to cities. The continental breakfast was just fine: bagels, toast, fruit, cereal, and juice were available. I had plenty of food to fill me up for breakfast. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly suprised”
Reviews.Author: mark z
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on business. Hotel is on the outskirts of downtown near Chinatown and is slightly seedy, but not bad if you're an urbanite. Was given an upgrade to a suite for no extra charge. The hotel is old but very well-maintained, quiet and clean. The room was huge and comfortable. The bathroom seemed original and had a very large tub with a good shower. Free wireless which was slow, but tolerable. The clientele was very diverse. This is a great place for the budget-minded. There is also an old cafe called Felipe's around the corner which is an LA institution. Great, cheap breakfast and atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Good budget hotel”
Reviews.Author: shellyship
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 2 nights. I would stay here again, you get what you pay for. Rooms were clean, breakfast was adequate, staff were fine, location was a walk away from Union Station. The WIFI however was not good, we stayed in several budget us hotels during our holiday, this was the only hotel with very SLOW pretty useless internet access .

Reviews.Title: “Convenient located.”
Reviews.Author: aarontanek
Reviews.Content: Big room and walking distance to UNION station, Olvera Street and China Town (nothing much here), and City Hall. Breakfast and WIFI internet are free; however we have to be in lobby to get the WIFI connection. There's a small mart, SUBWAY, and a Mexican Restaurant beside the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience at the Metro Plaza, with a few flaws”
Reviews.Author: wanderer
Reviews.Content: I stayed two nights at the Metro Plaza and was generally pleased. My room was large and decently featured. It had plenty of light in the daytime and was quite dark at night. It looked out on a curious feature of the property--a kind of low intensity strip mall at the back of the hotel's second floor. My room was near a bend in the building, so it was important to keep the curtain closed when I wanted privacy. The neighborhood is very busy during the daytime, but there was no noise at night. The bathroom was huge, though it didn't have any heat source and could be rather cold, at least until it got steamed up. For some reason the bathroom door wouldn't stay open, even when I wanted it to. The bathtub also didn't hold water, it drained out slowly, so I had to take showers. The only major facilities problem was that the internet in the building was not working for much of the time I was there. It didn't matter that much, except that it prevented me from printing out a boarding pass in a timely fashion. A minor problem was that the chain had slipped on the door and didn't work, though there was a deadbolt. As someone who advocates car-free traveler, I have to give the Metro Plaza props--it is the only hotel in Los Angeles I have ever seen with the Metro transit system posted in the lobby. Of course, being a block from Union Station, it is right at the heart of that system with numerous trains and buses available. There's the non-stop Flyaway bus from Union Station to LAX airport. The Metro Plaza is really a good choice for a car-free traveler who's looking for a budget (by LA standards) hotel. The Famima quality convenience store in Union Station stays open 24 hours a day, so you need never starve! Otherwise the neighborhood gets pretty quiet at night, though not dangerous (you are likely to see some homeless people sleeping on the street). I only ate one meal nearby--at Nick's Diner on the edge of Chinatown. I've eaten at Phillipe's, a few doors down and at Homegirl Cafe a couple of blocks away, which is part of a re-entry program for gang kinds. There are also lots of daytime/early evening eateries in Chinatown, which the hotel is adjacent to. One of these years I'll eat at the beautiful Traxx restaurant in Union Station. So despite flaws, a good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best choice for sightseeing tourist”
Reviews.Author: SwarleyBravo
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights, the purpose of our trip was to see as much of LA as possible. For those who aren't familiar with the geographic layout of LA, everything is very widespread and unless you feel like paying triple figure's for taxi's public transport is your best option. Which is why the Metro Plaza was perfect, it is located within a 2 minute walk from Union Station, which is the central transport hub for LA (Amtrak train to Disneyland, bus to Santa Monica, trains to Hollywood, Universal Studios). The room is more than adequate, nice comfy bed, modern amenities, everything was no fuss. We barely saw staff as we left early and came back late, our room was always serviced to our liking. Some people have commented on the location being scary, I didn't experience this. While there are several homeless people in the area they are harmless and a friendly no when they ask for change is all you need. All the areas near the hotel are well lit and populated, including the path to Union Station. Tip: check out Olivera Street, the historical birthplace of LA and Mexican cultural hub, I no longer feel like I haven't been to Mexico, great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good access to transit from here, bit scary location”
Reviews.Author: busanio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is cheap and only 2 blocks fro L.A. Union Station, so that's why I ended up here on a long distance train trip once. The place was real busy, seeming to cater to groups of foreign students and the like when I was there. The place is not real fancy and not real clean, with slow elevators and grubby hallways leading to average motel rooms. The windows in my room overlooked other guest rooms, so that was uncomfortable. The area around the hotel is gentrifying a bit but still has a long way to go. The people in the lobby were mostly polite and the staff did their best to keep up with what appeared to be inadequate technology to deal with checking in and checking out. Not a lot of great options for dining nearby, couple of mediocre taco restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre but well located”
Reviews.Author: Cris-Traveler-Brazil
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. The best feature is the location, 2 blocks from union station (bus flyaway from airport) and metro red line to all touristic sights. It is located in chinatown and you can find good restaurants with sea food around. Staff were friendly. On the negative side, the room was smelly, not 100% clean and only few chanels in English available on tv. It was quite noisy. Towels were not very soft and over bleached.

Reviews.Title: “A good surprise”
Reviews.Author: Tingvorl
Reviews.Content: We'd streetviewed the locality before we decided to make this our overnight stay between Amtrak trains from San Francisco to New Orleans. In fairness, we weren't expecting too much other than the convenience of its location to Union Station. However, the room was clean, if a little worn, and the bathroom was excellent. The staff were helpful and the light breakfast was OK. It's possible to walk the short distance from the station to the hotel even with large roller suitcases but it's true to say that there are quite a few people down on their luck roaming around the streets. We had time to kill in the morning and the Mexican market, restaurants and entertainment in the square opposite the station (it was a Sunday) and 300 yards from the hotel were superb. All in all, a good choice for our short stop and value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for this need”
Reviews.Author: jasonxreed
Reviews.Content: Walk from AMTRAK Union Station. WiFi included; very light breakfast. Loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Metro Plaze Hotel Los Angeles, CA”
Reviews.Author: gram03_10
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a safe, convenient, clean, quiet and budget priced hotel room walking distance from Union Station and downtown LA this is the hotel for you. Parking is reasonable and seconds from the hotel elevator. Breakfast is minimal but adequate. Not suitable for night life access - best for getting a good night's rest. Staff is friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect within this price segment”
Reviews.Author: hons82
Reviews.Content: We had booked 2 rooms for 5 people for 4 days. Actually we arrived one day earlier and instead of looking for a best western or a something inn, we decided to ask if we could extend our stay in the hotel. The guy at the reception was really friendly and could even arrange that we could get 2 rooms next to each other which where the same ones as for the already booked nights. So we had not to check out at 11am and wait till 3pm to re-check in into other rooms. In addition he gave us immediately a lot of info about the city and where to go. The rooms had two queens, TV, AC, refrigerator andeach one its own bath room, so nothing to complain. In the lobby you can take free coffee 24h a day, so if you like me don't need any breakfast except a cup of hot coffee you could even sleep longer than the breakfast time which ended at 9am i think. The breakfast itself is quick small, so it has coffee, tea and some juices and to eat mainly toast bread and marmalade and beagles. We decided to take this hotel beside its economical prices mainly because it is just a few steps from the union station away, from which each part of the city is reachable, even if the metro system in LA is quite difficult to understand. At the end I would say that our main focus in these days was around the hollywood bvld so it would have been better to take a hotel in that zone, however there are a lot of interesting places even reachable by walking directly from the hotel (chinatown, little tokyo, toy district, downtown) and some of the far away destinations like Santa Monica beach, which is definitly a must see in LA, depart only from the union station (big blue bus) Fazit: The only reason for not choosing this hotel if you are looking for a cheap stay would be to stay nearer to hollywood which makes you independent from the metro which stops working at 1 or 2 am, and by the way it takes quite a long time from hollywood to downtown using the metro. that's it basically. Stay at this location and have a wonderful time in LA like we had

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Shirshendu
Reviews.Content: The hotel is really very near to Union Station from where you can go almost anywhere in LA by public transportation. My next plan was to catch the Go-to bus for Grand Canyon tour. The location was very near as well from hotel. The room was clean, drinking water was available for free (in the lobby), and the coke machine was really cheap!! So very nice experience. Definitely recommend this hotel if you want to explore LA by public transport.

Reviews.Title: “Very good!”
Reviews.Author: Maryathena
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very clean. I can overlook it being out of date a little. Especially for the price it was great. I did smell the subway in the elevators, but not in the room. I found the staff friendly and helpful. Everyone complaines about continental breakfast, it was what you would typically find in the U.S. in less you stay at a $200 or more room. My only complaint was the T.V. had about seven channels and three were in Chinese. I will stay again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “DO NOT!!! I Repeat, DO NOT Stay at this property.”
Reviews.Author: BrooklynNY11230
Reviews.Content: From driving into the parking garage I could tell this was a mistake. I used the property's online booking system to make my reservations and they couldn't find it. I provided them a copy of my confirmation that I printed and still couldn't find it. Once they finally put me in a room, the front desk called me to ask if I had checked in 2 days earlier. I advised him that I couldn't have being that I just arrived from NYC that morning. I was surprised I was charged a nightly rate vice hourly. When I tried to log in to my laptop to try to find other accommodations, there was no "complimentary high speed Wi-Fi" that their wedsite boasted about. I was told I had to use the computer in the lobby and be charged. When I called, using my cell phone, 17 different hotels I was advised that due the a convention in town and the NBA Playoffs, there was no vacancy anywhere in Los Angeles. I had to go to the mall and buy sheets and towels, I refused to use what they had in the room. The smell of Subways was making me sick in the middle of the night. Restfull beds my tush... It was like sleeping on 2 box springs. I've had more restfull nights sleeping on the steel decks of a US Navy warship. Their website also states that all rooms have a spacious in room refrigerator, dorm room size that need to be defrosted. Also 'premium cable channel", I don't believe they had cable or a dish hook up. The alarm clock was glued to the night stand. Please, do yourself a favor, look elsewhere. I ended up in San Diego at the Solomar Hotel and paid $20 more per night and the service / room was a complete 180 degree turn.

Reviews.Title: “not a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: zippy18
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious and bathroom clean. I was charged extra for the teenagers room as they had two seperate beds and the logic was that it would take longer to clean!!. the safe wasnt working.Breakfast in polystyrener plates was very disappointing! Never have we been served any meal in a hotel in paper plates!! not much variety in the cereal! the croissants were not fresh at all. Staff could be more friendly. The area is not very nice the only thing good was the Union station nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Do not stay here, service is TERRIBLE!!!”
Reviews.Author: snorris98
Reviews.Content: Traveling with 1yrs old son and husband for an event downtown. Neighborhood is not good even if we did not have the baby. Yes there is a fee of $4 a day for parking and room was roomy but nothing great. We booked 2-nights but ended up leaving with in minutes at 1:00pm the next day. There was some kind of festival going on and they allowed those attending to park in their VERY SMALL garage (which they often double park as they can make extra $ daily) we tried their second level parking and was told I could not park there. Also there is a Subway next door in which the baking bread you can smell ALL DAY AND ALL NIGHT long..ugghhh!! Continental breakfast is sad, banana's were bruised and other then bread nothing more to choose from.

Reviews.Title: “Good, no frills hotel 2 blocks from Union Station (Amtrak)”
Reviews.Author: RDHOnTheGo
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here a few times and have been quite satisfied. This is a good, basic, no frills hotel with nice size rooms and baths. My rooms have been clean and quiet. TV channels are very limited. For the price, this is a great value in downtown Los Angeles an easy walk through Olivera Street to Union Station. There is a nice Continental breakfast offered at no extra charge in a small room off the lobby. There are restaurants and fast food outlets nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Best value and so close to Union Station and the Flyaway to LAX”
Reviews.Author: SkyMcCain
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here and it again surprised me at how modern and pleasant the hotel is compared to others at such a reasonable price. There doesn't appear to me to be a better deal for the price. Walking the two blocks with my wheely bag was so easy. For food, Philippes, just at the corner heading left on Main from the hotel is quite an adventure. They have been in business for ages and where else could you find a cup of coffee for a dime? The place is not fancy and you have only benches to sit on but the prices are low and the food good. When I wanted to check in at 1PM there was no mention by the desk clerk of the 3PM check in policy. I immediately got a room. Now, don't be shocked that you pay 50 cents for local and 800 calls and a $2.00 fee to use the computer to do your flight online check in and 50 cents for printing a boarding pass. The quality and low price of a room more than makes up for these minor charges. You can't beat the Metro Plaza for a Los Angeles stopover.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad at all”
Reviews.Author: chas118
Reviews.Content: I was passing through LA arriving by train at Union Station and wanted a hotel within easy walking distance. The staff was friendly, the room was fine and the continental breakfast better than average.

Reviews.Title: “not as bad as i thought!”
Reviews.Author: ching_wa
Reviews.Content: After seeing the mixed opinions on the hotel, I prepaid for one night just to test it out. The area is a bit sketchy, since it is right by Chinatown, but I felt alright walking around even during the evening. I think the homeless jut minds their own business and won't come and bother you. The price is really good and there was also complimentary breakfast. The best thing we found was that a water fountain with good tasting water was on each floor, this saved us a lot of money for buying water! The rooms are a bit old, but clean. I would stay at this place next time I visit because of it's great location, so close to Union station, as well as the friendly staff. If you are not looking for something fancy, this is a good choice for you.

Reviews.Title: “as advertised, but...”
Reviews.Author: anemonefish
Reviews.Content: The Metro Plaza is close to City Hall (3 blks.), Union Station (1 blk.), historic Olvera Street (diagonal), China Town, and much of the LA downtown cultural scene adjacent to the 101. If location and price are primary, go for it. Just know that the neighborhood can be urban rough, as well. In-house covered parking at $4/day is a bargain. The hotel offers a conventional continental breakfast bar with numerous restaurants nearby, ranging from Philippe (a classic and home of the French dipped sandwich) to Mexican, Chinese, seafood, barbecue, fast food (adjacent), etc., etc. Also grocers handy. Rooms offer a fridge (as opposed to mini bar). Hot and cold water dispenser along with ice and cola machines. No in-room coffee maker, but free coffee in the lobby 24 hours. Staff was friendly enough. Housekeeping was good. A few loose tiles in the large bathroom - clean grout. Linens adequate. King bed was thin and firm, bordering on hard. Air was via a trusty Friedrich cool/heat unit installed at floor level - windy & noisy cycling. Some rooms have large windows facing the streets, others on the back are built around 3-sided mini-air shafts such that one window faces the adjoining bedroom, the other a parking lot. TV is a weak spot if you plan to spend much time in the room. Only a few local channels on offer, plus a couple of Chinese and Spanish language options. No cable news, business, etc. Probably the worst selection we've encountered at a hotel in a major western city. Two fire alarm glitches during our stay. The Metro Plaza is serviceable. The price is fair. You can upgrade significantly for $20-30 dollars/day, but the location has a lot going for it, especially if LA cleans itself up.

Reviews.Title: “Great location plus good value.”
Reviews.Author: seemlb
Reviews.Content: My stay here was great. I could get to many areas of LA FAST such as LAX, Hollywood, Sana Monica, Beverly Hills and Dodger Stadium from here. I had a large king size bed in my room and could adjust the heat or ac depending on the time of day. I slept well each of the three nights I stay here. The breakfast with real orange juice was good. The very helpful Shane checked me in, put me in a quite room, and printed my boarding pass. I ate at the nearby subway every night. Thanks Shane. Wish I could have stayed for the rest of the Dodgers homestand.

Reviews.Title: “Fine if no car”
Reviews.Author: BJPToronto_Canada
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a place near Union Station so that we could catch an early morning train. This place fit the bill nicely. It was a 5 min walk with suitcases door to door. The Subway sandwich shop opened really early in the morning so you can pick up your lunch on the way to the station. Breakfast starts at 6:30 at the Metro Plaza, so that was perfect. Another budget hotel in the area did not serve breakfast that early so that is something to consider if you are taking a train. The room was very small and dark. But hey, it was only for a night. The bathroom, however, was very large. The internet did not work when we tried it, but I am sure that had we taken the laptop to the front desk, they could have straightened us out. We really did not need it for that one night. The breakfast room had a suitable number of tables. The continental breakfast was basically two cereals (and when did you ever see CocoPuffs as one of the two choices?), juice and white toast and fruit. I have two main complaints about the hotel. One, our room overlooked a restaurant (I think) that starts revving up at 5:30 am. The sound was like a garbage truck making it's collections,except it never ended. Now, this did not bother us as we were getting up then for our early train. But had we been planning to sleep in, we would have been concerned and probably asking for another room. Our other complaint was the parking. I pulled up to the hotel and wanted to park in the garage for a few hours till it was time to take the rental car back. But the young lad would not let me into the garage as they were renting out the spaces for the Cinco de Mayo festival which was being held in the park next door. There was also no place to stop in front of the hotel to unload luggage either. I was in a real dilemma as I was alone at the time (my husband was coming in on the train) and did not know what to do. After a few times around the block, I found a parking lot that would let me "rent" a space for 5 minutes while I dropped our luggage. The front desk insisted that there was room in the garage and I could park there, but obviously they were not telling that to the parking attendants as I made it clear I was a guest and I was still denied admission. But I was able to drop off my suitcases and then change my plans and take the car back to the car rental place early, just to get rid of it since the hotel had no space. But I think if I were to stay here another time,with a car, I would call the hotel first and ask if there were any special events in the area planned for my stay. If I were traveling on the train, I would not hesitate to stay here again as the location is wonderful for train travel. I am not sure if I would stay here for an extended visit though. But for what we paid and it's location, it was fine.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, good location”
Reviews.Author: kathiejmie
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located just a few minutes walk from Union Station, which is very convinient, because you can get practically anywhere in the city by bus or metrorail. The hotel itself is very clean. Our room was huge, the biggest room I ever stayed at. The hotel offers free wi-fi and breakfast (very simple though). There was just one small problem. There were three of us sharing the room but the staff kept forgetting that and left only two sets of towels and blankets. And we had to ask for the third set every single day, which was annoying. Other than that, everything was great.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely, clean hotel near Union Station”
Reviews.Author: freddo56
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, arrived early morning and a room was ready for us before the usual check in time. Quiet, clean room with adequate facilities. Simple breakfast included but very welcome. Handy to Union Station for train connection.

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring Los Angeles”
Reviews.Author: Dromomaniac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Metro Plaza Inn for 4 nights so that we could explore downtown Los Angeles 7 found it great for that purpose. Union Station is just across the street, Olvera Street with all it's great Mexican food is just across the street, and Hollywood & Universal Studios are a quick metro ride away. From the Metro plaza we caught the subway to Hollywood, Universal Studios and the La Brea Tar Pits - all of which were great for the kids & us adults. We also explored Chinatown, which is a quick, free dash bus ride up the road. We found we could go out all day, then return to Olvera Street for a great dinner. The hotel itself is an older, motel style place, but it's clean, comfy and in a great location. It's not a fancy hotel, but it's somewhere central and clean to lay your head after a day of sightseeing and the beds are very comfortable and the rooms are large. Some of the staff are indifferent, but we found the younger guy at the front desk very helpful with directions and suggestions. The price is very good for the area and the continental breakfast was good - fresh breads, cereals, tea & coffee, most downtown hotels seem to be a lot more expensive and don't offer free breakfast..

Reviews.Title: “Good value; a clean hotel with continental breakfast right by Union Station.”
Reviews.Author: sleepercar
Reviews.Content: My partner, my parents, and I stayed in the Metro Plaza for two nights around New Year's Eve, 2009/10. Our rooms were spacious and extremely clean. The hotel was very quiet. We had self-serve continental breakfasts with plenty of choices -- fresh fruit, cereal, bagels, toast, danishes, donuts. The price was great -- I think we paid $80 per room, per night. The location was superb -- a block from Union Station (we were travelling by train), and across the road from Olvera Street. On New Year's Eve we had a delicious and very affordable meal at the Regent China Inn next door. But a budget hotel is rarely without its downside. In this case, the heater in the room was loud and could not be left on at night if we were to get any sleep. As a result, our room was cold. Bring a warm set of PJs if you go in winter! Overall, I would recommend this to anyone who is not fussy and is not in pursuit of luxury.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location, with parking - clean but a little dated”
Reviews.Author: OlafB
Reviews.Content: I was looking for a relatively cheap hotel (i object to paying high hotel prices) in a good location; I found it at this hotel. First, there is ample parking for which there is a small fee which is a great advantage in LA. Thankfully there was none of that valet nonsense which annoys me (I am quite capable of parking my own car). The staff were helpful despite their English being a little limited. The hotel was well located and it only used to take us about 15 minutes (if that) to get to the main attractions in the city. It was clean and perfect for what I needed; basic, clean, good location. Breakfast was adequate (bagels, rolls, cereal, etc). the hotel is right next to china town and union station. All in all, I was happy.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: SUSANNAHOPE
Reviews.Content: In September I was travelling with my partner in California. In Los Angeles we stayed in the Metro Plaza Hotel which is opposite Grand Union Station. It was a good price - under A$100 (including taxes, room charges etc.) per night - including breakfast. It is nothing fancy - but clean and comfortable - staff very helpful - and from outside the door can catch bus or train to anywhere. We were able to go to Disneyland for $1 each (seniors fare) and 85c to Hollywood, Santa Monica and loads of other places. 10c for around LA in the bus called DASH. Breakfast was good - lots of room - and tea and coffee available in the foyer 24 hrs. There is a Mexican market nearby, open every day and evenings, we had yummy Mexican food for approx $5, and were able to browse and buy souveniers. Also there are Chineese and Janapese resteraunts which are frequented by locals - good food at a good price. Don't go walking in the park, as unfortunately there are quite a few homeless people about asking for money.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location- Train-Plane-Walk”
Reviews.Author: MaggieMaySc
Reviews.Content: I was a little leary considering some of the reviews...but very pleased with the hotel. My sons stayed here for three days to see the Dodgers and visit LA. They rode the train in and flew out home. You could not find a better location, right across from Union Station which has "Fly Away" service to LAX! Rooms were clean, roomy and comfortable. Staff was very helpful. There were plenty of tv stations for my family......the locals as well as the standard cable channels such as espn etc etc. Well worth the $$$. A very good experience.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, good value”
Reviews.Author: WStaso
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Metro to answer a jury summons at the federal court. The hotel is just a couple of blocks from the parking lot for the court. It is in a business area with a lot of local traffic but it was quiet inside the room. The subway downstairs was open late and was busy but clean looking. The room was relatively inexpensive, had a helpful person at the desk and an equally helpful security man. The parking area, under the hotel, seemed reasonably secure with cameras. The room was clean, the bed was firm, and the only noise I heard all night was from the air conditioning unit. The continental breakfast was basically cold cereal, bagels, and juice; but the breakfast room has plenty of tables and free copies of USA Today. The other hotel guests I encountered looked like upstanding people. I would stay there again under a similar situation.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for price but not great either”
Reviews.Author: terminator33
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel 3 times in the last five years when doing business at the federal building. Previously the Days Inn and now the Metro Plaza. The good points are location and price. Its only about a five minute walk to the federal building, right next to historic Olivera Street, and near Union Station. Its one most affordable hotels in downtown LA. Free internet, cheap parking. About half the price of the nearby Kyoto Grand. I paid about $80 a night mid-week. The rooms are clean but aging and in need of a makeover. At least they seem to do a good job with housekeeping, much more now as the Metro Grand than when it was a Days Inn. The walls are also fairly thick and soundproofing is decent. It is mostly quiet at night. Most rooms have connecting doors which I normally don't like, but the doors are thick, solid oak doors that don't let in noise from next door. I had a few problems connecting to the internet but the front desk staff was friendly and helped me correct the problem. The downsides are the area is kind of shady, especially at night. In their defense, so is most of downtown LA. I've been approached by beggars outside the hotel on all three trips over the last five years, but none appeared overly threatening or violent. The architecture is kind of weird also, as hotel is located in a type of strip mall. Their are walkways outside the 3rd floor windows, so you don't feel safe unless you keep your windows locked, and the stairwell doors on the third floor were propped open on my latest visit. Don't know for sure but it gives the impression that some of the homeless from outside could just wander in if they wanted to. Wouldn't recommend this hotel for women traveling alone, the young or the elderly, but able bodied adults probably could live with this hotel for a few days for the price if they need or want to be in downtown LA.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient for Union Station Railway Station”
Reviews.Author: hm192
Reviews.Content: I stayed here in May 2009. It's about a five minute walk (with suitcases) from Union Square - this may well be it's chief selling point. It's clean and functional - A-OK for an overnight stay if you have to catch an early morning train. The staff were friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “best choice near Union Station”
Reviews.Author: NJphotoGuy
Reviews.Content: I arrived at the Metro-Plaza at noon and was afforded an early check-in. Housekeeping had not cleaned the room, but that was not a big deal as I was just dropping my bags before going out on the town. The room was clean when I returned in the evening. Basic toiletries were provided. Towels are cheap and thin. Free wifi was a plus and reception was good in my third floor room. The location is very good if your travel plans include a train ride. While the area was not upscale, I didn't feel unsafe even though I was approached by a beggar just outside the hotel. Restaurant choices were limited. There is a Subway sandwich shop next door. A block away is Philippe's, where you must try one of their french dipped sandwiches. They are absolutely delicious. For value. and convenience, the Metro Plaza is a good choice. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Deal in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: Gcruik
Reviews.Content: Reasonably priced hotel in LA. With $4.00 covered parking. Very close to Union Station, a must see for its interior beauty. Traxx restaurant is worth a visit too. Evening desk person is clueless. Day time seemed to be better.

Reviews.Title: “A bed for a night before catching train”
Reviews.Author: SafariMan149
Reviews.Content: All I needed was a bed for a night after flying in and before catching a train from Union Station. Great location for Station but little else. Dispite being 6'2" and large, wouldn't feel safe in area at night. No decent resturant at hotel or near by. Room clean(ish)

Reviews.Title: “Not sure about quality vs. price and services”
Reviews.Author: SkyTravelPRG
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel for 4 nights in December 16.-20.2008. Property has good locations, max.10 minutes from Union Station L.A. I got a room with two double beds with street view. Beds and carpets old. I expected something else according to hotel photos, which are on their website. Reality is regret much different. Hotel provide wireless internet for free. Regret PC with internet access is paid, 2 USD per hour, 1 printed page - 0,50 USD. I paid 89 USD for single room/night + 14% tax. Breakfast was limited. Two kinds of cereals, bagels, toasts, butter cake. Cream cheese, jam, butter.

Reviews.Title: “I t was close to everything, but....”
Reviews.Author: Fam_O_3
Reviews.Content: The Metro Plaza hotel was very convenient for our family of 3 to stay at because we arrived via Amtrak at Union Station. We were able to walk to the hotel with no problems. The Subway next door was also convenient for quick food on the first night, since we arrived late. We were easily able to catch the Metro Red line train to Universal Studios with no difficulty and get back to Union Station to rent a car when we wanted to branch out further. The location of the hotel was excellent, but there were some problems. The room was quite spacious, actually surprisingly so for the money, but we never quite seemed to get enough washcloths (3) despite the fact they knew that there were 3 of us staying in the room. You do have to pay for parking, but at $5 a day, it was worth it since parking is so bad in the area. There was no guide to the TV channels (most were in Spanish anyway), and when we asked for one, we were told they just had "regular channels" even though we said we were not from Los Angeles, so our channels were different. There was no TV remote in the room, and when asked for one (along with a guide for the TV) that portion of the question was ignored. We actually found the remote the day before we checked out, under one of the beds. Even though the breakfast was not a deciding factor in choosing a hotel, the thought of not having to look for breakfast in a new city was nice, however when we went down for breakfast the first day we quickly discovered why other reviews on breaksfast were so bad. The area was small, with nowhere left to sit, the food lackluster at best and it looked like some people had walked in from the street to eat, and weren't guests at the hotel. Thank God for Philippe's being nearby in walking distance, with excellent service and breakfast for a very reasonable price. The beds were lumpy and one of them had a dip in it, and creaked alot. Two of the chairs in the dining area had large stains on the seats. Decent stay if you are only looking for somewhere to sleep at a busy day of siteseeing, and somewhere close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “Not happy.”
Reviews.Author: Bill-and-Laura
Reviews.Content: Like all the prior reviews I read of the great location and general consensus of hotel/room condition, I do agree. I was okay with everything until walking into the dark bathroom, flipping on the light and seeing a bug scuttle across the counter! A kleenix box was setting on the counter, I grabbed it and smashed the bug ... to discover that it was a cockroach! I did not sleep well even tho I didn't see any others or evidence of others, but doubt we will stay there again. I did add two photo's showing proof of it on the bathroom counter and I did compare to online photo's to confirm before submitting this review.

Reviews.Title: “It really ok, great value, great location”
Reviews.Author: GratefulDave
Reviews.Content: I would clearly recommend it. Its no frills, clean, right next to china town and Olivera street (Mexican food and some historical stuff), across from the train station and the California Endowment. I have stayed here twice for business (free wireless and breakfast included). I had a deluxe suite for 149 per night, it was large, had kitchen, nice bathroom. can't complain. No room service. Health Club or exercise room is very limited I could easily stay in big fancy hotel in downtown hotel and have stayed at the Biltmore and grand Whilshire (I am not paying for the room), but I prefer this place. Downtown is so boring at night. This is a real good deal. In my terms, I would rate it "just fine".

Reviews.Title: “Good Place to stay in Downtown LA”
Reviews.Author: jaggirl30
Reviews.Content: I stayed in this hotel because I was summoned for Jury Duty service at the District Court nearby. The location is perfect if you are as "lucky" as I am and have to go for Jury Duty. There are lots of good places to eat - there is a Subway Restaurant right outside the front door, and several Mexican Food Restaurants across the street on Olivera Street. As for the room itself, the carpet had a few stains, the curtains were fading and worn from the sun, the furniture wasn't the newest, but for the price it is worth it - the sheets are clean, the people were very friendly, and the wireless internet service worked great. The second night I was in town the hotel was booked and I had to go somewhere else where I spent double the money and the accomodations were the same. Parking is only $5.00 per day, the cheapest I could find anywhere around. I will be staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “A good hotel with great rates!”
Reviews.Author: drbabbers
Reviews.Content: Check In: Straight forward and speedy. Although the lady at the front desk didn't seem to be a very nice person. I asked for a receipt for the travellers cheques I left to settle our balance, as I didn't trust her. She may have been a nice lady, but I didn't get that inital impression. Location: A 2 minute walk from Union Station, surrounding neighbourhood seems OK. About a good 5 minute walk to a shopping mall also. Sat right next door to a Subway for all you sub fans! Hotel: We were checked into room 330 on the 3rd floor, this was a 1 king bed room, I was not happy with the room. There were iron burns on the carpet, but my main complaint was we were next door to a smoker, who decided to open his window to smoke, he also had his air con blasting, which was right next to our window, so everytime this guy decided to smoke we could smell his cigarettes. Plus the door that seperates the rooms was letting smoke in. Quite a silly tactic to check in smokers next door to non-smokers.. particularly when they are literally a few feet apart room to room. I went downstairs and spoke to a very polite and understanding gentlemen on the front desk and he initally said there were no suites avaliable for us to be moved, so I went back upstairs, we tolerated it for another few hours, I went down and complained again, he then moved us to room 335 on the 3rd floor, which was a very nice and spacious 2 queen bed suite. This room was great! No complaints at all and he also let us have it for the same rate at 79 bucks a night! This suite was normally 100 and above I believe, so it turned out really well. Free wireless internet is great, they have free breakfast, although I was never up early enough to sample it! One thing I will mention is there is a general kind of smell to the hotel, without being offensive to anyone, I would describe this as a kind of 'Chinese smell'. I had to use an air freshener in our suite to get rid of this smell, which I personally didn't feel comfortable breathing in over our 3 day stay. Staff: Everyone I dealt with was great, apart from the lady who checked us in. She seemed very moody and miserable. Overall: I would recommend this to anyone who wants cheap and decent accommodation in Los Angeles. The rooms are well worth the money and this is the best feature, cheap and good quality accommodation. The suite I was initally in was fine, considering the rate, but providing we weren't sat next door to a smoker! The new suite was a great bonus for us, so thank you to that kind gentleman who resolved our issues.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location in LA”
Reviews.Author: SineNomine69
Reviews.Content: I "Googled" the Metro Plaza Hotel and was taken to Booking.com to make my reservation. I chose it mainly because of its proximity to LA's Union Station as I was taking a round-trip private dome car rail excursion to San Diego the next day. Driving in from the Ontario Airport, the Metro Plaza was easy to locate off the I-10 and CA 101. One of its best features is very reasonably priced in-house parking (I paid an average of $6/day!). The hotel's lobby is on the ground floor with rooms on the 3rd and 4th floors. The desk staff is Asian, helpful, and eager to please (I was immediately given a tube of toothpaste as the TSA Nazis in Kansas City had confiscated mine). The building has a number of other commercial ventures on its first floor and is convenient to several Chinatown restaurants as well as Phillipe's, (a big favorite of mine and LA folks owing to the terrific French dipped roast beef sandwiches) and that little, touristy Mexican "village" rife with restaurants and gift shops. My room had two queen-sized beds, a mini-fridge (very important as I need to chill my insulin), a table with 2 chairs, a built-in desk with chair and a portable room safe on which I could mount my Bi-Pap machine. The maid had inexplicably left the drapes open during a heatwave (108 degrees when my plane landed) and it took the air conditioner almost 3 hours to adequately cool the room. However, once cooled, it was very comfortable. I paid a rate of $89/night plus taxes and parking which, for downtown LA is a bargain. No, it's not the Biltmore, the Bonaventure, the Marriott, or the Omni, but it's clean, has the basics (an abundance of towels in the very large bathroom) and is convenient to public transportation (two Dart lines and the Red and Gold lines at nearby Union Station to say nothing of standard bus lines on the corner). The halls were quite stuffy, but again, there was a heat wave.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!”
Reviews.Author: Travelswithmutts
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a comfortable, inexpensive hotel near great public transportation (that puts you near most everything in the greater L.A.-area), the Metro Plaza is a really good bet. I just returned home from a 3-night stay there and was pleasantly surprised. I didn't want to hassle with a car, so upon arriving at LAX, I went to the curb outside the A.A. terminal and waited for the FlyAway bus that goes directly to Union Station for $2 each way. Once at Union Station, walk through the tunnel to the front (train side) of the building, take a right and walk half a block to Cesar Chavez Street. Take a left and walk half a block and there you are, right in front of the Metro Plaza. My check in was uneventful, my room on the 4th floor was quiet, clean and had GREAT A/C and good shower pressure. The bed was comfy and HBO was included. Free wi-fi is included in every room, a nice bonus. The continental breakfast, from 6:30-9:00 a.m., is basic, but just fine. Muffins, bagels, bananas, juice and coffee, along with a free USA Today. Olvera Street, the original L.A. settlement is right across Cesar Chavez and offers lots of good low-price Mexican restaurants. China Town is up Cesar Chavez going in the opposite direction. Take a right on Broadway and walk under the giant dragons, you will definitely know you have arrived. Within easy walking distance from the hotel are Thai, Vietnamese, Chinese, Mexican and a Subway restaurant. About 3 blocks away is City Hall and other governmental buildings. From Union Station, the metro will take you anywhere quickly, cheaply and safely. I really can't think of any negatives...the Metro Plaza is good basic accommodation, no frills but very comfortable. I would not hesitate to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good location/hotel depending on your interests”
Reviews.Author: lipsticktraces
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a good value and choice for those who are interested in seeing downtown LA (including Olvera Street, Chinatown, Union Station) and saving money. If you don't have a car and have a short stay focused on the above sites, this hotel is perfect. You can walk to everything (Mexican/Chinese/other restaurants), and the Red Metro Line stops out front and goes to Hollywood. However, if you are not comfortable in urban environments with homeless people on the sidewalks, etc., this is not a good choice. If you have a car, this is still a good choice -- parking is only six dollars a day, and freeway access is excellent. I plan to stay here again. The wi-fi was great, the room clean/safe, and the staff was friendly.

Reviews.Title: “good value for the money”
Reviews.Author: SUBWAY41
Reviews.Content: Large, CLEAN rooms. Easy walk to Union Station. Desk staff a little confused, (make sure you have a copy of your confirmation) . Would recommend for singles and couples.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel very near union station”
Reviews.Author: yarr0w
Reviews.Content: excellent location, hotel, room ,service and continental breakfast for the price. very near union station for amtrak and public transportation in l.a. area.

Reviews.Title: “Worn and Ragged...Barely Worth 2 Stars”
Reviews.Author: smub
Reviews.Content: Since most reviews here said the place was Ok, we decided to book this place for our last night in LA. Well, this hotel is definitely not a lovely place. The lobby is probably the most updated. Our room was VERY worn, the wallpaper had stains on it, the bed was potato chip thin and the nail polish stained dresser looked gross. We felt very itchy all night long and couldn't wait to check out the next day. It is right near the train station..that is true. But the neighborhood leaves alot to be desired too. If you are looking for a place near the train, you might want to take the rail to union station and then take the metro (red line) to hollywood. Much nicer hotels there! If you don't care what your hotel looks like or where you stay. But if you like to sleep calmly and feel at least a little comfy on your vacation - then spend a bit more and go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “everything you'll need”
Reviews.Author: blackhabbit
Reviews.Content: pleasantly surprised. best deal in area. two block walk to union station. all day come and go parking for only $4 for my two day stay. big mini fridge. huge bathroom. neighborhood is fine, no worries.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and spacious room”
Reviews.Author: Merlion42
Reviews.Content: Me and my friend stayed in Metro Plaza Hotel for 3 days (from 10-12 Nov). The Good: (1) The hotel is just walking distance from the Union Station, and transport from LAX airport to Union Station is cheap and easy (Flyaway airport shuttle, which takes around 40mins, only $4 per person). (2) The room (including the bath room) is spacious and quiet. The breakfast serves very basic stuffs but was okay cos we didn't expect much. We thought the service was not too bad (as opposed to what previous reviewers mentioned) cos the owner actually explained to me patiently and helped me solve my problem of not being able to make call from the room. When we asked for directions to the Huntington's botanical garden, she helped us to find out what bus to take and where to take. Perhaps they have improved their service =) Now the ONLY bad: We found a cockroach in our bedroom. We called the front desk for help and luckily the attendant was fast to react. In less than a minute he came to our rescue... before the cockroach escaped. That's the only bad experience we had. All in all, I think the hotel is still fine and would probly stay there again =)

Reviews.Title: “Beat value in LA”
Reviews.Author: Persia69
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in LA many times and this would have to be the best value and best location. Caught the Flyaway to and from from LAX for $4 each way to Union Station then a five minute walk to the hotel. Used the Metro from Union Station on a $5/day pass to get around on buses and the subway and saw everything we wanted to. Clean, neat, convenient, good value with breakfst included- can't beat that.

Reviews.Title: “Shaky Start But Only Got Better”
Reviews.Author: dopplersmash
Reviews.Content: Well, after reserving on the hotel's own website months before, I was not happy to arrive at the front desk and be told that there was no record of my reservation. Fortunately, I had my confirmation e-mail with me. It all worked out as I was given an oversized corner room that I probably wouldn't have otherwise. From there, everything smothed out. The property was clean, conveniently located near Union Station (note that it is margially walkable with luggage even if you are in reasonably good shape) and a short taxi ride from Dodger Stadium (plan on $7-$12 each way depending upon traffic). The continental breakfast was nothing fancy but more than adequate, and a hotel staffer was continuously on duty to clean and monitor the food. All in all, for a city hotel at a moderate price, I was pleased with the accommodations itself. You might want to confirm your reservation, however, prior to showing up.

Reviews.Title: “Good for 1 night”
Reviews.Author: MarluHolland
Reviews.Content: We (my girfriend and I) spent 2 nights here after a long flight from fiji. The hotel is only 5 min away from union station and the flyaway bus service. In essence we agree with the previous review. The rooms are big and clean and the beds are comfortable, although the airco is making a lot of noise while not cutting the job (e.g. get the temp. down in the room). The location is good if you have your own car or do not mind a 5 min walk to union and taking the sub for 20 min to Hollywood. Now the bad stuff: First of all the staff is indeed really rude. Not even a smile when checking in and my girlfriend is claustrophobic and asked to use the stairs, but to do this you first have to take the elevator to the 3rd floor, walk back to the 2nd to open up the backdoor to let her in. The owner/manager was really disrespectful of this and actually yelling to her about it. So really do not expect any good service/hospitality from the chinese, they are just after your money. Secondly, the breakfast is a joke. Just some toast and bagels/muffins, a banana and some cereals, cheese and marmelade. On both mornings, cleaning staff were eating from the buffet as well and on both mornings they were vacuumcleaning the hallduring breakfast, which was very annoying. During this, the manager got into a loud argument with one of the arriving guests..... We would reccommend this hotel just for one or two nights because it is cheap and conveniently located from the airport and downtown/public transport. Hope this helped, Regards from Holland, M&L

Reviews.Title: “I didn't have to stay to find out how rude the manager is.....”
Reviews.Author: churchladi
Reviews.Content: I was trying to book for my group I spoke with a few people first person told me she did'nt have time to book me so call tomorrow and send my request by faxs. but call ahead to let them know. then I didn't fax it because I needed more info. I call back and try to reserve same rooms the manager told a different price when I told her I have been quoted another price because i have aaa she told me " well we'll see what you have when you get here I will not give that price until then ."very confrontational" she asked me who would be in the room I told her some children 2 adults she said " well we'll just see when they check in how old they are because some people lie and I will not let you or your group have that rate until I see the children" I said what if a child looks older do we have to show birth certficate? She was very confrontational , very rude The office staff does not have a clue they say one thing she says they don't know and ups the price . I 'am soo glad I didn't stay

Reviews.Title: “It is a hotel only for one night”
Reviews.Author: Sissi70
Reviews.Content: The Lobby and the most of this Hotel are smelling from the Subway Restaurant, which is beside from this hotel. I had room 430 and it was not smelling, but very noisy from outside. I booked for 6 days. At my second day in this hotel I saw one cockroach. The cockroach tryed to follow me in my room from the floor. I killed the cockroach and thought now, it is over, but the third day I saw a new cockroach on the wall in the near of my bed. I caught the cockroach and brought it to the reception. But the staff ignore the cockroach and throwaway it. The hotel was outbooked and I could not change the room. But I think, it is not only the problem in my room. I tryed to find another Hotel, but they was all to expensive for me. Now I caught dayly one cockroach. And at my last day I found one in the bathtub. I was happy to leave the hotel early in the morning. When you will stay in this hotel let your baggage closed and check all by leaving the hotel. The good thing is, that the hotel is very near by all attractions and Los Angeles is very nice. The hotel staff is helpful and gives much informations for tours and the staff is very fast to repair things in the room. The hotel room is clean and I wonder, why cockroaches in this room / Hotel. Or is it normal for a downtown hotel. Sometimes I thought, that I am to sensitive????? I will not come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location if you don't have a car and are coming by train”
Reviews.Author: travelcommons
Reviews.Content: I rate this property a 5 because of it's super location, amenities and unbeatable price... - Location Bonus #1....My girlfriend and I arrived 4 hours late on our Coast Starlight Amtrak. Instead of arriving at 9pm, we arrived at 1:30am. The hotel is a 5-7 minute walk 2 blocks away from the main entrance of Union Station. It is located on a busy street, so even late at night we didn't feel unsafe or worried because there was plenty of light and a Chevron gas station was right next to the hotel (bright lights!). And with all of our luggage, the hotel's location was a lifesaver since the subway system was no longer running and we didn't feel like spending money on a taxi. - Location Bonus #2.. Cheap restaurants are less than one block away, including a Subway, multiple Chinese restaurants (with lunch specials for only $4 including rice and soup!), a BBQ joint ([--]), and the Original Phillipes, which is recommended by the Frommers guidebook. - Location Bonus #3.... you are one block away from Chinatown, and one morning we took a 90 minute walk around by following helpful markers that map out the route and provide detailed history about the area. It is also located across the street from Pueblo de Los Angeles Historical Monument, which is a pedestrian-only street with vendors, restaurants, a church and a museum. All free too! - Location Bonus #4.... since we didn't rent a car, we bought Metro Bus Day passes that work on the lightrail/subway, the regular buses, and the DASH buses. If you want to forgo buying the bus pass, then for only 25 cents you can ride the DASH bus that will take you all the way to the heart of LA, and from there you can connect with other DASH buses. DASH buses are great because they are cheap and they run every 5-10 minutes on fixed routes. And with a stop so close to the hotel, you can't go wrong with relying on the DASH. - Amenities. There is an on-site parking garage for people that have a car. I think that the rate is maybe $8 a day? Can't be sure though, just call them. The continental breakfast was an added surprise, fresh and sufficient. You have 2 types of cereal, milk, coffee, tea, apple juice, orange juice, donut bars, bananas, bagels, english muffins, jams/jellies, cream cheese. No waffles or anything hot like that, but it did a good job of holding us over until the late morning and the nice thing is that it runs from 6:30AM-10:00AM. The 2nd floor of the hotel has a fitness room that wasn't too small and looked fine. There is also free cold/hot water dispensers located next the elevators on each floor, so it was great to fill up your water bottle before heading off. Check out was 12pm. -Accommodations/Price--totally fine. Nothing fancy. It was clean, there's a few cable channels but no premium channels like HBO or Showtime. The room came with a small fridge and toiletries like soap and shampoo. Real hangers in the closet. Nothing much else, it was perfect for our 2 nights and at only $75, it just can't be beat. I saw a sign that at the front that also offers 10% off to AAA members, so if you have your card, Show It! Didn't have much interaction with the staff. We were checked in quickly at 1:40am in the morning. Check out was quick. They do take your credit card at the beginning of your stay and put a hold of like $50 or something. One last thing is that they have racks of tourist brochures, including $8 off Knott's Berry Farm. Plus maps for the LA Fashion District, Hollywood, Santa Monica and more. The front desk also has walking tour maps of Chinatown and information for catching the bus to Santa Monica. This was a good visit and I would not hesitate one bit to stay here on my next visit to LA, especially if I don't have a car to get around.

Reviews.Title: “Clean Room, but some Unfriendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Garrance
Reviews.Content: Two issues: Cleanliness & Customer Service. Cleanliness: My room was clean, and that is very important to me. The lobby area was also clean, but a bit drab.... it would serve them well to spruce it up a bit., and make it more cheerful. The elevator, however, had a stale odor, which I told the staff about. Customer Service: The woman at the front desk, who mainly works mornings, was cold, unfriendly, and unhelpful; in a nutshell, very unpleasant to deal with. On one occasion, I asked if she had a cup, so I could make tea, and she barked at me that there were cups in my room. I told her those cups were for cold beverages only, and wouldn't work well for hot water. Besides, I was running late to meet a friend, and didn't feel like going back up to my room for a cold beverage cup, especially when they had a restaurant in the hotel, and it would have been easy for her to allow me to get a cup from there, or get one for me. Instead, she gave me a dirty look, then went into the back room behind the front desk and got me a Styrofoam cup, which was dusty, and didn't look fresh. I had to rinse it off. I couldn't understand why she was so unaccomadating and miserable. On another occasion, when I was using their computer down in the lobby, I asked her if there was an outlet so I could charge my cell phone, and, with an obnoxious tone in her voice, she frowned at me and said: "there are outlets in your room, why don't you charge it there". So, I told her since I wanted to use the computer, it would be more convenient to charge it in the lobby while I was on the computer.. and also because I was expecting an important phone call. She gave me a dirty look and just pointed to an outlet near the computer. I could not believe how disrespectfully she treated me, it was unbelievable. So to summarize, she should not be working in the hospitality/hotel industry, because she has no clue what Customer Service is and has NO people skills whatsoever. Additional Comment: On a positive note, the night front desk clerk, who worked from 10 PM to 6 am, was a very nice man, very helpful, and friendly. FINAL THOUGHTS: Although I liked the room and the location was convenient to buses and trains, the customer service I received from this woman, was the worst I've ever had.

Reviews.Title: “Good enough for us!”
Reviews.Author: Lucie2
Reviews.Content: We were going to be in Los Angeles for 6 nights and were looking for a hotel not too expensive and giving us the opportunity to take different means of transportation (having chosen not to rent a car a this point in our trip). This hotel gave us what we were looking for. By walk, less then five minutes from Union station (where you could find subways to Long Beach, Hollywood, buses to Santa Monica, express bus to the airport, Amtrak) it was really easy for us to get from one place to an other. Being located in Chinatown gave us the opportunity to eat really good asian food and also being two minutes walk from Olvera street we ate mexican food one night that was pretty good. To get downtown, expect a 20-25 minute walk. I would say the area is safe even though, arriving on a Sunday, we were confronted to a lot of homeless people because there is a mission giving away food in the area and not much else going on in that area on week-ends. (If you are not ready to see homeless people, stay out of Los Angeles...). The room was clean, the air conditionning was working well (a little bit loud). The daily breakfast (included) was repetitive but still doing its job for us (toasts, english muffins, bagels, cream cheese, cereals, jam, coffee, juice). Everything went well with the owners with whom we didn't have a lot of contact during our stay. I would say it was a good bargain that met our expectations but I do think that if you like to be in a nice and more "friendly" area, you might prefere to go elsewhere. Would I go back again? Certainly if I was in the same conditions and had the same expectations.

Reviews.Title: “What a NIGHTMARE!”
Reviews.Author: MyTrip2
Reviews.Content: We had chosen this property for its proximity to the Union Amtrak station. "Walking distance," What a joke! Yeah, it's a couple of blocks and could be walked if you had minimal luggage. But absolutely not if you are on an extended vacation and have two check-on bags each! So there was a taxi expense. Then there is the car parking expense even if you are an overnight guest: $4 per night and $5 per day in advance if you park your car during your trip. We got lost trying to find the hotel in downtown LA and ended up touring Skid Row. Calling the hotel for help was a joke. They were giving me wrong directions in broken English. This hotel is right in Chinatown. I was not prepared for the culture shock. Then, although the room was old but clean, the air conditioning unit was not working. When they sent the owner up, he sat silently looking at it and replied after a few minutes that the hot roof had made the large room hot and that it would take awhile...the room never did cool completely and we sweated out the night. Upon the eve of our return while still onboard, I realized that Amtrak was running 11 hours late and would not arrive in time to check into this hotel. So I called the hotel directly and was treated very disrespectfully by the hotel owner's wife. She said "too bad", I made the reservation and did not call 24 hrs in advance to cancel. Nothing could persuade her to have mercy and not charge us for a room that we could not possiblly check into due to circumstances beyond our control. So needless to say, I would not stay here again under any circumstances. I will catch the train anywhere but downtown LA, like Simi Valley or even Van Nuys, or perhaps San Diego where accomodations are hopefully more reliable.

Reviews.Title: “Second stay here”
Reviews.Author: rplove5662
Reviews.Content: This was my second stay here and I was pleased once again. It is convenient, affordable, and clean. The bed was very comfortable. The only problem was an additional $10 for my fourteen year old daughter (which I thought was ridiculous) and they wanted to charge us a parking fee for dropping off our luggage in their parking garage. They did take it off finally. The staff was professional but I felt like they did try to add on additional $$$. Breakfast was so-so. I would stay here again as it is convenient to Amtrak, food, the bed was very comfortable, and it was spacious and clean.

Reviews.Title: “Super convenient”
Reviews.Author: seaspecimen
Reviews.Content: We stayed there to go to a party in the downtown area, about 2 miles from the hotel. We returned to the hotel at 3 am and had to be let in to the garage because they keep it locked at night. Comforting to know our car would be safe. The room was nicer than I expected for the price. The hotel is clean. The night staff a little slow. From our 4th floor room we could see the end of Olvera street and Union Station on the other side of that. Very nice. Quiet. Breakfast is just carbs and dairy but if you want protein there are taquerias on Olvera St. For LA the price is relatively good and it isn't a dump. If you care more about value and convenience than fancy frills that cost extra then this is the place.

Reviews.Title: “So-So for LA Marathon”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here to run the LA marathon this year, 19 March '06. The hotel was very convenient to Union Station, and a quick ride on the Metro to the starting line, near Pershing Square. I asked them if we could have 2pm (vs. noon) check-out on Sunday, so I could take a shower after the race. Although the hotel was clearly not full, they wouldn't allow it. Not too friendly. Other downtown hotels allow late check-out on Marathon day. The room was fine, nothing special. If you can book at one of the hotels near the starting line, as we have in the past, it's better; more friendly to marathoners.

Reviews.Title: “Quite a good choice”
Reviews.Author: pwelch
Reviews.Content: This hotel surpassed my expectations, I arrived early (around 10am) and it was no problem to check in and get my room. The rooms were quite spacious, very clean and tastefully decorated. Whilst the hotel did not have any luxuries (coffee maker or mini bar) it did have a fridge in the room. Its location was reasonable, a good place to access public transport the Metro and buses are available from Union station. There is a Subway next door and a petrol station over the road - so at least you won't starve. The management were helpful and friendly.

HotelInfo.Name: Metro Plaza Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 711 North Main Street, Los Angeles, CA 90012
